txt.en: Listen to Frithwyn
Talk to Edhild at Céolstan's grave
Talk to Ránmald

'I shall miss ye, Céolstan.'

Edhild bows her head, and when she looks up again, her eyes are sharp and clear.

'I'll help Ránmald and see that the son of Céolstan, my future Thane, will survive this fell winter. I swear it on this grave.'
The women of Byre Tor can be found at Aldstan's grave.\n\nYou should speak with the women.
'I've seen enough, ye troublesome meddler. Let us return to the Steaping Cave.\n\n'I'll not give Ránmald any more trouble.'
You should speak with Edhild at Aldstan's grave.
Talk to Céolflad.
'What now, hm? Are ye telling us how we should grieve for our own Thane? Aldstan is our loss, not yours.'
Meet the women of Byre Tor at Aldstan's grave

You ask Céolflad of what squabbles she speaks. What is the women's problem with Ránmald?

'It is no longer my concern. Now leave me be, meddler. Ye have struck me hard with grief, bringing me here to see my dear Thane in the ground.

'I'll be kind to the girl from now on. For him.'
Speak with Edhild
Listen to Céolflad's speech
Talk to Frithwyn at Céolstan's grave.

'Why did ye have to bring me here, [placeholder]? I did not want to see him like this, buried, surrounded by wicked Orcs!\n\n'This was a cruel trick. Ah! It is a stab of pain to see Céolstan this way!'
Listen to Frithwyn.
Talk to Edhild at Céolstan's grave.

'Ye heard right, [placeholder]. I thought Céolstan would be mine forever, and he let me think so, until he brought Ránmald here.

'I'll never like her, no matter how hard ye try to stir pity in my heart. When I look at her...

'...I see that I was not good enough for him.'
Talk to Edhild again.
Ránmald feels isolated from the other women, and you do not wish to leave her alone with them in her vulnerable condition.
You should speak with Ránmald.

'They do not accept me. Do you see how they will not stand near me? Without Céolstan or the Thane nearby, they will be openly unfriendly.\n\n'I have always been kind to them, [placeholder]! I must get used to being alone, until the child comes.'
'Leave us be, meddler! Ye'd rather talk to the nobility than to us, anyhow, eh?'
'Don't ye involve me in it, stranger. I've no love for the girl either, even if the Thane wished things different.'
'She thinks she's better than us, that's why! Has ever since she came to our little town from the south, from some fancy city.'

'You see? There is no hope to reconcile us.'

You ask Ránmald for a few moments to speak alone with the women outside.

'Yes, I will be fine by myself. Take as much time as you need.'
Talk to Ránmald
Ask Céolflad why she is cold to Ránmald
Ask Edhild why the women do not like Ránmald
Ask Frithwyn why she does not like Ránmald
Fixme!
<rgb=#FF0000>Roar</rgb> at the unkind women
Ask Ránmald if she will excuse you while you talk to the others
You should speak with Ránmald.
You should speak with Céolflad.
Ránmald is clearly isolated from the other women, a dangerous problem for a pregnant woman who must survive a harsh winter
Ránmald is clearly isolated from the other women, a dangerous problem for a pregnant woman who must survive a harsh winter
You should speak with Edhild.
Céolflad is indignant towards you for associating with Ránmald
You should speak with Frithwyn.
Edhild will not explain, despite the Thane's dying wish that Ránmald should be accepted

'They do not accept me. Do you see how they will not stand near me? Without Céolstan or the Thane nearby, they will be openly unfriendly.\n\n'I have always been kind to them, [placeholder]! I must get used to being alone, until the child comes.'
Listen to Céolflad's speech.
Frithwyn resents that Ránmald is an outsider
You should express your frustration and <rgb=#FF0000>roar</rgb> at the women.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This objective requires an emote.</rgb>
The women are unconcerned by your frustration
You should speak with Ránmald.
See if Edhild needs comfort
Talk to Céolflad
Instance: Isolation Amongst Survivors
Talk to Frithwyn at Céolstan's grave
